title: Hasse–Arf theorem
summary: In mathematics, specifically in local class field theory, the Hasse–Arf theorem is a result concerning jumps of the upper numbering filtration of the Galois group of a finite Galois extension.  A special case of it when the residue fields are finite  was originally proved by Helmut Hasse,[1][2] and the general result was proved by Cahit Arf.[3][4]
